author: barnabasbusa
content: Not sure where is a good place to discuss but I'm really against https://github.com/ethereum/staking-deposit-cli/pull/315 and https://github.com/stake-house/wagyu-key-gen/pull/153 (think this should be reverted). Maybe this could be brought up at all core devs, and hear the opinion of the devs on this?

author: benjaminion
content: The staking-deposit-cli one is a draft PR - feel free to comment on it there. You'll need to take up the Wagyu one directly with them, it's out of scope for the core devs. (Fwiw, I also dislike these.)

author: barnabasbusa
content: A general consensus from the devs would be good to voice regarding this though.

author: barnabasbusa
content: as far as I understand there were no plans to stop supporting BLS key deposits from any client combo, is that correct?

author: barnabasbusa
content: new beaconchain contract would need to be launched i guess

author: benjaminion
content: It would not require a new contract - the deposit contract is oblivious to the withdrawal credentials. But we will likely be supporting 0x00 on the beacon chain forever now, at least until the very last validator has switched, anyway. However, discussing tooling is not really in scope of ACD calls. You have my view (above); others can comment here; but I expect you are unlikely to elicit any general consensus.

author: alexssd7fp
content: I see, thanks for extensive explanation <@881905303011086387>! I appreciate it a lot

author: alexssd7fp
content: Might want to consider implementing SSZ support in all implementations anyone could ever use (or at least try to do that) to avoid situations where someone needs to do emergency upgrade after hard fork banning non-SSZ transactions is live but there is no implementation. Ethereum is an old project, and there are a lot of old tools/libraries that are no longer supported, yet some still use them.

author: alexssd7fp
content: Also, instead of banning non-SSZ transactions at once, I would suggest slowly but steadily increasing the base gas cost for non-SSZ txs (21k now) before banning them

author: alexssd7fp
content: (Assuming that the ban is needed at the first place, IMO it shouldnâ€™t be there  at all)
